info.title: Trading
info.description: The Trading API allows the development of the full trading capabilities in the eToro platform

post.description:
The account login method provides the ability to login to the eToro system.

This operation is essential as it provides the credentials that are needed for subsequent API calls. The username and password are related to an account

201.description: Login successful. The response will contain two members which need to be sent in subsequent requests as header variables

401.description: This will be returned in case the login operation failed

delete.description:
The DELETE operation will perform a logoff from the account.

It is important to note that the values of x-token and x-csrf-token must be sent as headers to this request. These values were returned from the Account/Login POST command

parameters.name: subscription-key
parameters.description: subscription key in url

get.description:
The Trade method returns the open trades of the user according to the system

It is important to note that the values of x-token and x-csrf-token must be sent as headers to this request. These values were returned from the Account/Login POST command

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The system type where the data is requested from

parameters.name: subscription-key
parameters.description: subscription key in url

parameters.name: Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key
parameters.description: subscription key in header

200.description:
An array of trades. Each trade contains the following:

positionIdintegerThe position ID is a unique identifier of the trade
instrumentIdintegerThe instrument ID of the trade. For a full list of IDs use the Metadata/Instruments API
isBuybooleanAre we buying or selling the instrument
leverageintegerThe trade's leverage
openRatenumberThe trade's opening rate
openTimestampdate-timeThe timestamp of the opening of the trade
stopLossRatenumberThe stop/loss rate for the trade
takeProfitRatenumberThe take-profit rate for the trade
orderIdintegerThe original order ID in case the trade was opened with a LMT order
socialTradeIdintegerThe ID of the social trade. If the trade was opened with regular trading, the value will always be 0
parentPositionIdintegerThe ID of the parent social trade. If the trade was opened with regular trading, the value will always be 0
investmentnumberThe current invested amount in the account base currency
initialInvestmentnumberThe initial invested amount in the account base currency
feesnumberThe total fees accurred in the account base currency
unitsnumberThe number of units held on the asset in this trade

get.description:
The Order returns all the open orders in the system

It is important to note that the values of x-token and x-csrf-token must be sent as headers to this request. These values were returned from the Account/Login POST command

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The system type where the data is requested from

200.description:
An array of trades. Each trade contains the following:

positionIdintegerThe position ID is a unique identifier of the trade
instrumentIdintegerThe instrument ID of the trade. For a full list of IDs use the Metadata/Instruments API
isBuybooleanAre we buying or selling the instrument
leverageintegerThe trade's leverage
openRatenumberThe trade's opening rate
openTimestampdate-timeThe timestamp of the opening of the trade
stopLossRatenumberThe stop/loss rate for the trade
takeProfitRatenumberThe take-profit rate for the trade
orderIdintegerThe original order ID in case the trade was opened with a LMT order
socialTradeIdintegerThe ID of the social trade. If the trade was opened with regular trading, the value will always be 0
parentPositionIdintegerThe ID of the parent social trade. If the trade was opened with regular trading, the value will always be 0
investmentnumberThe current invested amount in the account base currency
initialInvestmentnumberThe initial invested amount in the account base currency
feesnumberThe total fees accurred in the account base currency
unitsnumberThe number of units held on the asset in this trade

post.description:
The Add Entry Order allows creation of an entry order in the system. There are several types of orders which are available and are defined using the OrderType and ExecutionType parameters.

The OrderType parameter may be either Market (abbreviated by MKT) or Limit (abbreviated by LMT).

The ExecutionType can be either Good Till Cancelled (abbreviated by GTC) or Immediate or Cancel (abbreviated by IOC)

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The system type where the data is requested from

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
The body defines the actual order
number
The Instrument ID on which the order references
boolean
Is the opened position on the buy or sell side
number
The requested leverage
number
The invested amount for the order
number
The number of units to buy (either this or the investment are mandatory)
string
The order type can be either 'MKT' for market orders or 'LMT' for limit orders
string
The execution type can be either 'GTC' for good till cancel orders, or 'IOC' for immediate of cancel orders
(optional)
number
The stop loss rate for the position. This property is mandatory for limit orders and market orders which are immediate or cancel
(optional)
number
The take profit rate for the position. This property is mandatory for limit orders and market orders which are immediate or cancel
(optional)
number
The stop loss percentage for the position. This is mandatory for market orders which are good till cancelled MKT/GTC
(optional)
number
The take profit percentage for the position. This is mandatory for market orders which are good till cancelled MKT/GTC
number
The limit rate. This is relevant for limit orders LMT/GTC
boolean
Should the trade be opened with a trailing stop loss

200.description: The add order request has been dispatched. The return value will contain the execution token

get.description: The Instruments metadata returns the trading metadata on assets

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The trading system.

parameters.name: InstrumentIds
parameters.description: Optional list of instrument ids. The list should be comma delimited

parameters.name: subscription-key
parameters.description: subscription key in url

parameters.name: Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key
parameters.description: subscription key in header

200.description: An array of instrument metadata items

examples.application/json:
[
  {
    "instrumentId": 1,
    "precision": 4,
    "maxPositionUnits": 2000000,
    "isDelisted": false,
    "leverages": [
      1,
      2,
      5,
      10,
      25,
      50,
      100,
      200,
      400
    ],
    "defaultLeverage": 10,
    "minPositionAmount": 25,
    "maxStopLossPercentage": 100,
    "maxTakeProfitPercentage": 1000,
    "allowSell": true,
    "allowBuy": true,
    "allowLimitOrderGTC": true,
    "allowMarketOrderGTC": true,
    "allowExitOrderIOC": true,
    "allowExitOrderGTC": true,
    "allowTradeEdit": true,
    "allowMarketOrderIOC": true
  }
]

put.description: Editing the trade allows changing the stop loss (rate + trailing property) and the stop loss

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The system which we will be using

parameters.name: PositionId
parameters.description: The position ID which we would like to modify

200.description: The edit operation has been dispatched for processing. The return value will contain the execution token. The actual execution result will return through the notifications infrastructure with the token

delete.description: The Delete Entry Order allows cancellation of an entry order.

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The system type where the data is requested from

parameters.name: OrderId
parameters.description: The order id which we would like to delete

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
The body defines which order type to delete
string
The order type can be either 'MKT' for market orders or 'LMT' for limit orders

200.description: The add order request has been dispatched. The return value will contain the execution token

get.description:
The Order returns all the open exit orders in the system

It is important to note that the values of x-token and x-csrf-token must be sent as headers to this request. These values were returned from the Account/Login POST command

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The system type where the data is requested from

200.description:
The method will return an array of exit orders. Each order will contain the following members
number
The unique identifier of the exit order
number
The unique identifier of the trade which we are attempting to close
date-time
The timestamp of the creation of the exit order
number
In case the position is part of a social trade, it's ID will be returned

post.description: The Create Exit Order, will create an exit order in the system

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The system type where the data is requested from

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
The following is the structure of the body request
number
The position which I would like to close
string
The execution mode of the exit order. It can be either 'IOC' for immediate or cancel, or 'GTC' for good till cancelled
string
(Optional) Number of units to close

200.description: The add exit order request has been dispatched. The return value will contain the execution token

delete.description: The Delete Exit Order, will delete an existing exit order from the system

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The system type where the data is requested from

parameters.name: OrderId
parameters.description: The exit order id

200.description: The delete exit order request has been dispatched. The return value will contain the execution token

get.description:
The Credit method returns the current credit in the user account

It is important to note that the values of x-token and x-csrf-token must be sent as headers to this request. These values were returned from the Account/Login POST command

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The system type where the data is requested from

200.description: The method will return The credit

get.description:
The Equity method returns the current equity in the user account

It is important to note that the values of x-token and x-csrf-token must be sent as headers to this request. These values were returned from the Account/Login POST command

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The system type where the data is requested from

200.description: The method will return The credit, the realized equity (cash + invested amount) and the current amount that the user may withdraw

get.description:
The Historic equity method returns a time-series of the periodic equity of a user

It is important to note that the values of x-token and x-csrf-token must be sent as headers to this request. These values were returned from the Account/Login POST command

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The system type where the data is requested from

parameters.name: Period
parameters.description: The Requested Period

parameters.name: MinDate
parameters.description: Minimum Date

parameters.name: MaxDate
parameters.description: Maximum Date

parameters.name: Username
parameters.description: The requested username

200.description:
The method will return an array of equity items. In case the request is not authenticated all monetary values will be ommitted

startdatetimeThe timestamp of the beginning of the equity date
gainnumberThe daily gain. The gain formula takes into consideration cash-flow operations
isSimulationbooleanIs the value a simulated value or a real value
startCreditnumberThe credit at the beginning of the day. The credit is the amount of money which is not currently invested in a trade
startInvestmentnumberThe total invested amount at the beginning of the day
startPnLnumberThe P&L of the open trades at the beginning of the day
endCreditnumberThe credit at the end of the day. The credit is the amount of money which is not currently invested in a trade
endInvestmentnumberThe total invested amount at the end of the day
endPnLnumberThe P&L of the open trades at the end of the day
positiveCashflowsnumberTotal positive cash-flows during the day, Positive cashflows are mostly deposits
negativeCashflowsnumberTotal negative cash-flows during the day. Negative cash-flows are money withdrawals

get.description:
The Instruments fees returns the rollover fees that are charged in the system

It is important to note that the values of x-token and x-csrf-token must be sent as headers to this request. These values were returned from the Account/Login POST command

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The trading system.

parameters.name: InstrumentIds
parameters.description: Optional list of instrument ids. The list should be comma delimited

parameters.name: Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key
parameters.description: subscription key in header

200.description: An array of instrument fee items. The fees differ between buy/sell and leveraged vs. non leveraged trades. Each item has a daily fee and a weekend fee

get.description:
The Trade History method returns closed trades of the user according to the system

It is important to note that the values of x-token and x-csrf-token must be sent as headers to this request. These values were returned from the Account/Login POST command

parameters.name: System
parameters.description: The system type where the data is requested from

parameters.name: MinDate
parameters.description: Minimum date for the historic trades

parameters.name: Page
parameters.description: Requested Page

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: The number of values per pages which should be returned

parameters.name: Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key
parameters.description: subscription key in header

parameters.name: x-token
parameters.description: Security Token from Login Operation

parameters.name: x-csrf-token
parameters.description: Security Token from Login Operation

200.description:
An array of trades. Each trade contains the following:

positionIdintegerThe position ID is a unique identifier of the trade
instrumentIdintegerThe instrument ID of the trade. For a full list of IDs use the Metadata/Instruments API
isBuybooleanAre we buying or selling the instrument
leverageintegerThe trade's leverage
openRatenumberThe trade's opening rate
openTimestampdate-timeThe timestamp of the opening of the trade
stopLossRatenumberThe stop/loss rate for the trade
takeProfitRatenumberThe take-profit rate for the trade
orderIdintegerThe original order ID in case the trade was opened with a LMT order
socialTradeIdintegerThe ID of the social trade. If the trade was opened with regular trading, the value will always be 0
parentPositionIdintegerThe ID of the parent social trade. If the trade was opened with regular trading, the value will always be 0
investmentnumberThe current invested amount in the account base currency
initialInvestmentnumberThe initial invested amount in the account base currency
feesnumberThe total fees accurred in the account base currency
unitsnumberThe number of units held on the asset in this trade
netProfitnumberThe net profit of the trade in the base currency
closeRatenumberThe rate which the trade was closed
closeTimestampdatetimeThe timestamp of the closing
